name: BuildOpenApiDocument
description: Generates OpenAPI document(s) based on a build's output.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: serviceName
inputs.label: Service Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Friendly name of the service OpenAPI document(s) are being generated for.

inputs.name: visualStudioXmlDocumentationFileNamePatterns
inputs.label: Visual Studio XML File Name Pattern(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Names of Visual Studio XML files which document service REST APIs and data types. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/csharp/programming-guide/xmldoc/xml-documentation-comments)

**Important**
- Each line should contain exactly one file name pattern.
- File matching patterns may be used. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/tasks/file-matching-patterns)

**Tip**
When multiple projects in your solution make use of Visual Studio XML output, configure your projects to have unique XML file names. Otherwise, if your build requires XML files to have the same name, be sure to configure the "*Visual Studio XML Root Directory*" in the *Advanced* section below, so this task can find the correct XML files.

inputs.name: assemblyFileNamePatterns
inputs.label: Assembly File Name Pattern(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Names of assembly files which implement service REST APIs and data types found in Visual Studio XML Documentation files.

**Important**
- Each line should contain exactly one file name pattern.
- File matching patterns may be used. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/tasks/file-matching-patterns)
- Be sure to specify **dependent assemblies** as well, which are required to reflect into service/contract assemblies. For example, Newtonsoft.Json.dll might be a required dependency.

inputs.name: openApiSpecificationVersion
inputs.label: OpenAPI Specification Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: OpenAPI specification version to target.

inputs.name: format
inputs.label: OpenAPI Document Format
inputs.helpMarkDown: Document format to target.

inputs.name: outputDirectoryPath
inputs.label: Output Directory Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory path where OpenAPI document(s) will be written.

inputs.name: createOutputDirectoryIfNotExists
inputs.label: Create directory if it does not exist?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, this task will create the directory if it does not exist.

**When not set**, this task will fail if the directory does not exist already.

inputs.name: useCamelCaseForSchemaProperties_CsharpAnnotationsDocumentGenerationSetting
inputs.label: Use camel case for OpenAPI Schema properties?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, Schema object properties in the built OpenAPI document will be of camel case format. Recommended when a service application uses global serialization settings to enforce camel case request and response properties.

**When not set**, Schema object property casing will be inferred from source code names and/or attributes (e.g. JsonProperty, etc).

inputs.name: csharpAnnotationsDocumentGenerationAdvancedConfigurationFileName
inputs.label: Advanced Configuration File Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of C# Annotations Document Generator advanced configuration file, which controls optional document generation features. [More Information](https://github.com/Microsoft/OpenAPI.NET.CSharpAnnotations/wiki/Advanced-Configuration-XML)

inputs.name: csharpAnnotationsDocumentGenerationAdvancedConfigurationFileSearchPath
inputs.label: Advanced Configuration File Root Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Directory path where the C# Annotations Document Generator advanced configuration file should be searched for.

**Tips**
- Be sure to override this value when multiple configuration files exist with the same name in your build output.
- Consider using predefined build variables when your build outputs to a custom location (e.g. sources directory, binaries directory, artifacts directory, etc). [Predefined Build Variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/concepts/definitions/build/variables?tabs=batch#predefined-variables)

inputs.name: recursiveCsharpAnnotationsDocumentGenerationAdvancedConfigurationFileSearch
inputs.label: Perform recursive sub-directory search?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, a recursive search for the advanced configuration file will be performed starting from the *Advanced Configuration File Root Directory*.

**When not set**, only the *Advanced Configuration File Root Directory* will be searched.

inputs.name: failOnMultipleCsharpAnnotationsDocumentGenerationAdvancedConfigurationFileMatches
inputs.label: Fail when multiple files are found?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, this task will fail if multiple C# Annotations Document Generator advanced configuration files for the given name are found within the *Advanced Configuration File Root Directory*.

**When not set**, the first match found will be used.

inputs.name: documentDescriptionFileName
inputs.label: Document Description File Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Name of file containing the description content to inject into the resulting OpenAPI document's Info object. The file must be of UTF-8 encoding.

Please see various specification definitions for more details on this field:
- [2.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md#infoObject)
- [3.0.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.0.md#infoObject)
- [3.0.1](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.1.md#infoObject)

inputs.name: documentDescriptionFileSearchPath
inputs.label: Description File Root Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Directory path where the description file should be searched for.

**Tips**
- Be sure to override this value when multiple files exist with the same name in your build output.
- Consider using predefined build variables when your build outputs to a custom location (e.g. sources directory, binaries directory, artifacts directory, etc). [Predefined Build Variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/concepts/definitions/build/variables?tabs=batch#predefined-variables)

inputs.name: recursiveDocumentDescriptionFileSearch
inputs.label: Perform recursive sub-directory search?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, a recursive search for the description file will be performed starting from the *Description File Root Directory*.

**When not set**, only the *Description File Root Directory* will be searched.

inputs.name: failOnMultipleDocumentDescriptionFileMatches
inputs.label: Fail when multiple files are found?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, this task will fail if multiple description files for the given name are found within the *Description File Root Directory*.

**When not set**, the first match found will be used.

inputs.name: filterFileNamePatterns
inputs.label: Filter File Name Pattern(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Names of filter assembly files which implement filter classes to apply when generating OpenAPI document(s).

Important
- Each line should contain exactly one file name pattern.
- Each file name pattern requires a corresponding entry in Filter Class Name(s) input field. In other words, when three file name patterns are specified here, the task will expect three class names to be defined and will pair them by matching line numbers.
- File matching patterns may be used. [More Information](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/tasks/file-matching-patterns)

inputs.name: filterClassNames
inputs.label: Filter Class Name(s)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Names of filter classes to apply when generating OpenAPI document(s).

Important
- Each line should contain exactly one class name.
- Each class name requires a corresponding entry in Filter File Name Pattern(s) input field. In other words, when three class names are specified here, the task will expect three file name patterns to be defined and will pair them by matching line numbers.

inputs.name: filterFileSearchPath
inputs.label: Filter File(s) Root Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Directory path where filter files should be searched for.

**Tips**
- Be sure to override this value when multiple filter files exist with the same name in your build output.
- Consider using predefined build variables when your build outputs to a custom location (e.g. sources directory, binaries directory, artifacts directory, etc). [Predefined Build Variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/concepts/definitions/build/variables?tabs=batch#predefined-variables)

inputs.name: failOnMultipleFilterFileMatches
inputs.label: Fail when multiple files are found?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, this task will fail if multiple filter files for a given name are found within the *Filter File(s) Root Directory*.

**When not set**, the first match found will be used.

inputs.name: usePowerShellCore
inputs.label: Use PowerShell Core?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This setting only applies to Windows agents.

When set, the task will use pwsh.exe from your PATH environment variable instead of powershell.exe. **This option must be set when your assemblies target .Net Core** as opposed to .Net Framework.

inputs.name: openApiDocumentVersion
inputs.label: Document Version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
This value will be written into the resulting OpenAPI Document's *version* field of the Info Object.

Please see various specification definitions for more details on this field:
- [2.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/2.0.md#infoObject)
- [3.0.0](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.0.md#infoObject)
- [3.0.1](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/versions/3.0.1.md#infoObject)

inputs.name: visualStudioXmlSearchPath
inputs.label: Visual Studio XML Root Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Directory path where Visual Studio XMLs should be searched for.

**Tips**
- Be sure to override this value when multiple Visual Studio XML files exist with the same name in your build output.
- Consider using predefined build variables when your build outputs to a custom location (e.g. sources directory, binaries directory, artifacts directory, etc). [Predefined Build Variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/concepts/definitions/build/variables?tabs=batch#predefined-variables)

inputs.name: failOnMultipleVisualStudioXmlMatches
inputs.label: Fail when multiple files are found?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, this task will fail if multiple Visual Studio XML files are found with the same name within the *Visual Studio XML Root Directory*.

**When not set**, the first match found will be used.

inputs.name: assemblyFileSearchPath
inputs.label: Assembly File(s) Root Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Directory path where assembly files should be searched for.

**Tips**
- Be sure to override this value when multiple assembly files exist with the same name in your build output.
- Consider using predefined build variables when your build outputs to a custom location (e.g. sources directory, binaries directory, artifacts directory, etc). [Predefined Build Variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/concepts/definitions/build/variables?tabs=batch#predefined-variables)

inputs.name: failOnMultipleAssemblyFileMatches
inputs.label: Fail when multiple files are found?
inputs.helpMarkDown:
**When set**, this task will fail if multiple assembly files are found with the same name within the *Assembly File(s) Root Directory*.

**When not set**, the first match found will be used.
